com.github.robtimus.validation.date

Annotation Type DateMaxAfter


  • @Documented
 @Constraint(validatedBy={DateMaxAfterValidator.ForDate.class,DateMaxAfterValidator.ForCalendar.class,DateMaxAfterValidator.ForInstant.class,DateMaxAfterValidator.ForLocalDateTime.class,DateMaxAfterValidator.ForOffsetDateTime.class,DateMaxAfterValidator.ForZonedDateTime.class})
 @Target(value={METHOD,FIELD,ANNOTATION_TYPE,CONSTRUCTOR,PARAMETER,TYPE_USE})
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Repeatable(value=DateMaxAfter.List.class)
public @interface DateMaxAfter
    Validates that the date part of a date/time object is not more than a specific duration after a specific moment in time. More specifically, for a date/time object object, validates that object.date <= moment + duration.

    Supported types are:

    • Date
    • Calendar
    • Instant
    • LocalDateTime
    • OffsetDateTime
    • ZonedDateTime

    null elements are considered valid.

    Author:
    Rob Spoor

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      String duration
      The maximum amount of time, as an ISO 8601 duration, that the date part of a date/time object can be after the value specified in moment().
      String moment
      The moment against which to validate.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      Class<?>[] groups
      The validation groups.
      String message
      The error message.
      Class<? extends Payload>[] payload
      The payload.
      String zoneId
      The zone id to use.

    • Element Detail

      • duration

        public abstract String duration
        The maximum amount of time, as an ISO 8601 duration, that the date part of a date/time object can be after the value specified in moment().

        This duration may only have a date part, not a time part.

      • moment

        public abstract String moment
        The moment against which to validate. This should either be a value that can be parsed to LocalDate, or now to use the current moment in time as defined by the ClockProvider attached to the Validator or ValidatorFactory. The default ClockProvider defines the current time according to the virtual machine, applying the current default time zone if needed.

      • message

        public abstract String message
        The error message.
        Default:
        "{com.github.robtimus.validation.date.DateMaxAfter.message}"

      • groups

        public abstract Class<?>[] groups
        The validation groups.
        Default:
        {}

      • payload

        public abstract Class<? extends Payload>[] payload
        The payload.
        Default:
        {}

      • zoneId

        public abstract String zoneId
        The zone id to use. This should be system for the value returned by ZoneId.systemDefault(), provided for the zone id from the actual value, or otherwise a value that is accepted by ZoneId.of(String) for a specific zone id.
        • For Calendar, OffsetDateTime and ZonedDateTime, if the zone id is not provided, the value is converted to the given zone id before extracting the date.
        • For Date and Instant, no zone id is available, so provided is not allowed.
        • For LocalDateTime, no zone id is applicable, so only the default value (system) is allowed.
        Default:
        "system"
